objdescid.origination: William Blake author, inventor, delineator. Blake wrote and signed this receipt.

provenance.name: Yale University Library
provenance.note: John Linnell; from the Linnell collection; sold at Christie's, Dec. 2, 1938 to the dealer W. H. Robinson on behalf on Otis T. Bradley (in Lot 62 £78 15s); presented to Yale University Library by Mr. Otis T. Bradley in 1941 or 1942.

repository.department: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

desc.objtitle:
29 July 1826 Receipt, John Linnell, 29 July 1826,
Object 1 (Bentley Receipt 44)

objnote.p: Blake wrote and signed this receipt.

To the left of the text is an embossed revenue stamp depicting a coronet and sprigs of long, narrow leaves on its left and right. The word “RECEIPT” appears at the top and the words “THREE/PENCE” at the bottom.

lg.l: Recieved Received 29 July 1826 of Mrs Aders by the hands of
Mr Linnell the Sum of Five Pounds Five Shillings Keynes (*Letters*, page 163) reads "Two" for "Five". See also note for line 4.
